intro: Taeniophyllum quadratum, commonly known as the four-angled strobilanthes, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its square-shaped stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical study.
